summary: The 'Countering Untrusted Telecommunications Abroad Act' addresses national security concerns regarding untrusted telecommunications equipment and services, particularly those associated with Huawei and ZTE. The bill mandates reports on the presence of such equipment in US allies' networks and US embassies, focusing on 5G, Open RAN, and 6G networks. It also directs the Secretary of State to provide diplomatic and political support for trusted telecommunications infrastructure projects.
